result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Hearing held via Zoom.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Allen Dale Grant in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith; both appear by video.  Defendant Allen Dale Grant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 01CF5411. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer C. Laskey-Castle. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Pretrial Order, signed and filed.

DAR UNAVAILABLE DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES.  CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD.
Defendant Allen Dale Grant in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Allen Dale Grant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Allen Dale Grant appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
